cards.title: Equal Columns With Flexbox: It’s More Complicated Than You Might Think
cards.description: Discover which SVG patterns we should avoid and which ones are the most inclusive when comparing different combinations of OSs, browsers, and screen readers.
cards.author: Kevin Powell

cards.title: Are you sure that’s a number input?
cards.description: Not all inputs that accept digits should be inputs with type=”number”. This article will help you to be sure that you use them for numbers, not for things that just happen to be made up of digits.
cards.author: Kilian Valkhof

cards.title: Mobile-First CSS: Is It Time for a Rethink?
cards.description: Mobile-first design methodology has been a common design pattern for many years. This article explores the advantages and disadvantages of this approach.
cards.author: Patrick Clancey

cards.title: The State of Serverless 2022
cards.description: How serverless has evolved over the past years? How has it influenced our workflows?
cards.author: Jeremy Daly

cards.title: Forever Functional: Debouncing and throttling for performance
cards.description: In many cases, you want to limit how often a function is called. Implementing such limits can lead to complex code unless a functional technique is used.
cards.author: Federiko Kereki

cards.title: Bun
cards.description: Bun is a fast all-in-one JavaScript runtime with a native bundler, transpiler, task runner, and npm built-in. Bundle, transpile, install and run JavaScript & TypeScript projects
cards.author: all in Bun

cards.title: Learn how to build, test and deploy a bookstore app with React 18, Vite, and Netlify functions
cards.description: This guide will cover in detail the steps to create a working model bookstore single-page application using the latest React 18, and run it using Vite.
cards.author: Yevhen Kapelianovych

cards.title: How to Refactor Large React Components
cards.description: The story from a real project of how several developers worked on one component at different times and why structure is really necessary.
cards.author: Mohammad Faisal

cards.title: Data fetching with Suspense in React
cards.description: In this article, we will look at Suspense in React and see how it can be helpful in some cases.
cards.author: Marvel Ken

cards.title: The mystery of React Element, children, parents and re-renders
cards.description: Some basic things about React’s elements will help us dive into React mechanics to have a better understanding of their work principles.
